body:
This test is too simplistic/fragile and will fail to detect compatibility correctly.

See the test I have in #25111
diff_hunk:
@@ -1476,45 +1476,33 @@ if test "$use_boost" = "yes"; then
 fi
 
 if test "$use_external_signer" != "no"; then
-  case $host in
-    *mingw*)
-      dnl Boost Process uses Boost Filesystem when targeting Windows. Also,
-      dnl since Boost 1.71.0, Process does not work with mingw-w64 without
-      dnl workarounds. See 67669ab425b52a2b6be3d2f3b3b7e3939b676a2c.
-      if test "$use_external_signer" = "yes"; then
-        AC_MSG_ERROR([External signing is not supported on Windows])
-      fi
-      use_external_signer="no";
-    ;;
-    *)
-      AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether Boost.Process can be used])
-      TEMP_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
-      dnl Boost 1.78 requires the following workaround.
-      dnl See: https://github.com/boostorg/process/issues/235
-      CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS -Wno-error=narrowing"
-      TEMP_CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS"
-      CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS $BOOST_CPPFLAGS"
-      TEMP_LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS"
-      dnl Boost 1.73 and older require the following workaround.
-      LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $PTHREAD_CFLAGS"
-      AC_LINK_IFELSE([AC_LANG_PROGRAM([[#include <boost/process.hpp>]])],
-        [have_boost_process="yes"],
-        [have_boost_process="no"])
-      LDFLAGS="$TEMP_LDFLAGS"
-      CPPFLAGS="$TEMP_CPPFLAGS"
-      CXXFLAGS="$TEMP_CXXFLAGS"
-      AC_MSG_RESULT([$have_boost_process])
-      if test "$have_boost_process" = "yes"; then
-        use_external_signer="yes"
-        AC_DEFINE([ENABLE_EXTERNAL_SIGNER], [1], [Define if external signer support is enabled])
-      else
-        if test "$use_external_signer" = "yes"; then
-          AC_MSG_ERROR([External signing is not supported for this Boost version])
-        fi
-        use_external_signer="no";
-      fi
-    ;;
-  esac
+  AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether Boost.Process can be used])
+  TEMP_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
+  dnl Boost 1.78 requires the following workaround.
+  dnl See: https://github.com/boostorg/process/issues/235
+  CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS -Wno-error=narrowing"
+  TEMP_CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS"
+  CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS $BOOST_CPPFLAGS"
+  TEMP_LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS"
+  dnl Boost 1.73 and older require the following workaround.
+  LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS $PTHREAD_CFLAGS"
+  AC_LINK_IFELSE([AC_LANG_PROGRAM([[#include <boost/process.hpp>]])],

body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [Sjors](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25696#issuecomment-1373795414) |
| Stale ACK | [jarolrod](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25696#pullrequestreview-1141814896) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ð to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26557](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26557) (build: Update Boost to 1.81.0 in depends by hebasto)
* [#24742](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24742) (build: prune Boost headers in depends by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Thank you @luke-jr! Cherry-picked your commit from #25111.

body:
> Note there were 2 fixup commits as well. I think [a7fa0da](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/a7fa0da8611eb35ecd24284392f062a8ec47d037) might not be applicable here

For sure, since v1.78.0. See https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/171.

> but we probably need [06548df](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/06548df560f61c9deb5be09f72dd079833ec3c6b)?

That issue has also been fixed since v1.78.0. See https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/215.

body:
[Similar to #25111. I'm still ~0 on this change](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25111#pullrequestreview-970602390), but this approach is an improvement. 

Given #24907, I don't think we should be leaning back into more Boost code usage. Outside of that, it's pretty clear that Boost Process currently has no or minimal support for mingw-w64 builds. It looks like they don't even have a mingw-w64 build [in their CI](https://drone.cpp.al/boostorg/process/87) (only MSVC). Windows fixes, some that we've upstreamed, also remain ignored, i.e https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/237, https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/239, https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/240.

I assume if we make this change, external signing on Windows is only going to be supported with Boost 1.80.0 and later? If so, I assume we can remove https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/207a22877330709e4462e6092c265ab55c8653ac/src/test/system_tests.cpp#L10?
We support Boost down to 1.64.0 currently on non-Windows.

Changes in `wchar_t.hpp` look Windows-specific. FWIW, the first commit compiles with depends (boost 1.77) successfully.

@luke-jr Could you point at a configuration which fails?

body:
@fanquake 
> I assume if we make this change, external signing on Windows is only going to be supported with Boost 1.80.0 and later? If so, I assume we can remove
> 
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/207a22877330709e4462e6092c265ab55c8653ac/src/test/system_tests.cpp#L10

Correct. See #25723.
Rebased on top of #25723.

Is this patch from upstream? If so, can you add the upstream commit details / links here? If not, are you planning on upstreaming it? The fact that we still have to patch Process out the box, just to make it work, isn't encouraging. Maybe these fixes can make it into 1.80.0.

> If not, are you planning on upstreaming it?

https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/264
I can't test on Windows. Bumping the Boost version in depends should probably be its own PR? (or at least indicated in the PR description)

> Bumping the Boost version in depends should probably be its own PR?

See #25873.

Updated 0444353ba7e97b53ff7f4ed7f06d67ed36466912 -> 9077916135ddabc07f105a77da8eb2bf8de73469 ([pr25696.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.04) -> [pr25696.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.05)):

- rebased on top of the #25873
- a patch replaced with the [upstream one](https://github.com/boostorg/process/pull/264)
- undrafted

Rebased 9077916135ddabc07f105a77da8eb2bf8de73469 -> 75b51ed60350d63e1216be21f345bb297e697374 ([pr25696.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.05) -> [pr25696.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.06)) on top of the merged #25873.
I may have a Windows dual boot system in a month or so, so I can test stuff like this.
75b51ed60350d63e1216be21f345bb297e697374: Under what circumstances is this not defined? Maybe add a comment.
This has been merged. Do we know which release it's in? (so we can drop the patch once the depends version is bumped)

@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+Fix compiling for MinGW-w64 using std::filesystem 
+
+Upstream commit:
+ - https://github.com/boostorg/process/commit/a7b65bfc44f4af3a9d584fe9347fde0944c0167a

body:
It is, I'll try that fix.

Meanwhile tACK 75b51ed60350d63e1216be21f345bb297e697374

Rebased 75b51ed60350d63e1216be21f345bb297e697374 -> 8db9f3c4bd1e4ebad3b89738544b38f103a7690a ([pr25696.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.06) -> [pr25696.07](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.07)) on top of the merged #26377.

Rebased 75b51ed60350d63e1216be21f345bb297e697374 -> 86cb0b7168a2e011e5e2f6ac2a605db64b0525ba ([pr25696.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.06) -> [pr25696.08](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr25696.08)) on top of the merged #26377.

Tested 86cb0b7168a2e011e5e2f6ac2a605db64b0525ba using guix build. External signer works, but tests fail:

```
.\bitcoin-86cb0b7168a2\bin\test_bitcoin.exe
```
